title: Executive Order 6634-Lawrenceburg, Indiana, Designated as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by section 1 of the act of August 1, 1914 (ch. 223, 38 Stat. 609, 623; 19 U.S.C., sec. 2), Lawrenceburg, Indiana, is hereby designated as a customs port of entry in customs collection district no. 40 (Indiana), with headquarters at Indianapolis, Indiana, effective as of this date.
There shall be included within the limits of this port the adjoining town of Greendale, Indiana.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6634-Lawrenceburg, Indiana, Designated as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362403
